meanings.definition: A person who sees an event, typically a crime or accident, take place.
meanings.sent1: The witnessers at the scene helped the police solve the crime.
meanings.sent2: The witnessers provided valuable information to the investigators.
meanings.sent3: The witnessers shared what they saw with the authorities.
meanings.sent4: The witnessers' accounts painted a clear picture of the incident.
meanings.sent5: The witnessers' testimonies were crucial in the court case.

meanings.definition: To see (an event, typically a crime or accident) take place.
meanings.sent1: I witnessers the car crash while walking home.
meanings.sent2: She witnessers the theft and immediately called the police.
meanings.sent3: He witnessers the cat stealing food from the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: They witnessers the storm approaching from a distance.
meanings.sent5: The security camera witnessers the intruder breaking into the building.
